bugs.title: CVE-2022-42010 dbus: dbus-daemon crashes when receiving message with incorrectly nested parentheses and curly brackets [fedora-35]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-42010 dbus: dbus-daemon crashes when receiving message with incorrectly nested parentheses and curly brackets [fedora-35]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-42010 dbus: dbus-daemon crashes when receiving message with incorrectly nested parentheses and curly brackets

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in D-Bus before 1.12.24, 1.13.x and 1.14.x before 1.14.4, and 1.15.x before 1.15.2. An authenticated attacker can cause dbus-daemon and other programs that use libdbus to crash when receiving a message with certain invalid type signatures.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/10/06/1
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus/-/issues/418

Created dbus tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133619]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133621]


Created mingw-dbus tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133620]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133622]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8812 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8812

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8977 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8977

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:0096 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0096

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:0335 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0335

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-42010

bugs.title: CVE-2022-42011 dbus: dbus-daemon can be crashed by messages with array length inconsistent with element type [fedora-35]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-42011 dbus: dbus-daemon can be crashed by messages with array length inconsistent with element type [fedora-35]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-42011 dbus: dbus-daemon can be crashed by messages with array length inconsistent with element type

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in D-Bus before 1.12.24, 1.13.x and 1.14.x before 1.14.4, and 1.15.x before 1.15.2. An authenticated attacker can cause dbus-daemon and other programs that use libdbus to crash when receiving a message where an array length is inconsistent with the size of the element type.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/10/06/1
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus/-/issues/413

Created dbus tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133623]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133625]


Created mingw-dbus tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133624]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133626]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8812 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8812

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8977 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8977

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:0096 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0096

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:0335 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0335

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-42011

bugs.title: CVE-2022-42012 dbus:  `_dbus_marshal_byteswap` doesn't process fds in messages with "foreign" endianness correctly [fedora-35]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-42012 dbus:  `_dbus_marshal_byteswap` doesn't process fds in messages with "foreign" endianness correctly [fedora-35]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-42012 dbus: `_dbus_marshal_byteswap` doesn't process fds in messages with "foreign" endianness correctly

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in D-Bus before 1.12.24, 1.13.x and 1.14.x before 1.14.4, and 1.15.x before 1.15.2. An authenticated attacker can cause dbus-daemon and other programs that use libdbus to crash by sending a message with attached file descriptors in an unexpected format.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/10/06/1
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus/-/issues/417

Created dbus tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133627]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133629]

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2133628]
Affects: fedora-36 [bug 2133630]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8812 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8812

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:8977 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8977

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2023:0096 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0096

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2023:0335 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:0335

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-42012
